Information Package

Instructions

  • The application is comprised of an online application form and supporting documents detailed below. Late or incomplete applications will not be reviewed. Please note that this includes letters of reference.
  • Applicants are strongly recommended to complete the EPIC-AT HRTP Fellowship application (Section C of this package in either English or French) using preferred word processing software. The online application portal will open on 23 May, 2022.
  • Once you are ready to submit your application online, if you have not already done so, you must register with the AGE-WELL Forum Research Portal at https://forum.agewell-nce.ca/index.php/Special:HQPRegister (the form will ask for your name and email). After you submit the registration form, the system will create an account and send your credentials to the email address you provided. Once you login, you will have to reset your temporary password.
  • The “My Applications” link is in the top right of the page you will reach after resetting your password. Please select “EPIC-AT Award 2022.” Copy your application material and upload supporting documents to the AGE-WELL Forum Research Portal website by 5pm ET on 13 June, 2022.
  • Letters of support must be sent directly to training@agewell-nce.ca (details in Section B of this package).
  • Notice of Admissions will be received by August, 2022. Expected start date of fellowship is 1 September, 2022

Contact Information:
training@agewell-nce.ca

Background Information

About EPIC-AT HRTP

The Early Professionals, Inspired Careers in AgeTech Health Research Training Platform (EPIC-AT HRTP) is a national training platform that will prepare graduate students, postdoctoral fellows and early career researchers to be future leaders in digital health solutions for older adults with complex health needs.

Powered by AGE-WELL, EPIC-AT is led by researchers from 11 universities and research hospitals across 6 Canadian provinces. It is hosted at the University of Toronto. This unique platform is funded by the Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR) with additional support provided by 41 collaborating organizations from across Canada.

The competency-based, experiential learning platform is an extension of AGE-WELL’s globally-leading EPIC training program and will provide one-year fellowships to graduate students, postdoctoral fellows and early career researchers at Canadian institutions.

FELLOWSHIP PROGRAM

EPIC-AT Fellowships provide a minimum of $8000 to trainees and $10,000 to Early Career Researchers. Fellowships are intended to enable promising new scholars to participate fully in an exclusive 1 year training program. The program will focus on developing new skills and providing a breadth of experience in transdisciplinary working, stakeholder engagement and co-creation, the research-policy dynamic and the innovation and implementation process. The program will equip fellows to develop, implement and evaluate digital technologies that help older Canadians with complex health needs age safely, independently and with dignity in the setting of their choice.

EPIC-AT is built on a foundation of equity, diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We welcome and strongly encourage applications from all individuals including women, Indigenous peoples, visible minorities, persons with disabilities, members of the LGBTQ2S+ communities, mature students and all others who can contribute to the diversification of ideas to better support an increasingly diverse older Canadian population. You are encouraged to self-identify if you wish to do so.

Indigenous older adults are one of the most rapidly growing group of seniors in Canada. Due to the continued effects of colonization and systemic biases, Indigenous older adults face a higher and rising prevalence of complex health needs including multimorbidity. It is imperative to swiftly develop and implement culturally safe and appropriate solutions. As such, EPIC-AT welcomes applications from those who explicitly use Indigenous Ways of Knowing and will award a minimum of 2 Fellowships to self-identified Indigenous trainees or ECRs.

We expect to offer the following 1 year fellowships in this 2022 call:
  • 20 Master’s, PhD, and Postdoctoral Fellowships at minimum $8,000
  • 3 Early Career Researcher Fellowships at minimum $10,000

This represents the minimum value of fellowships. A number of postsecondary institutions and research institutes have agreed provide top up funding and/or travel funds to successful applicants from their institutions. Eligible applicants will automatically be considered for these additional funds; no additional application is required.

Benefits

These fellowships are an opportunity for trainees and early career researchers to:
  • gain in-depth, specialized expertise in developing, implementing and evaluating digital health solutions for seniors with complex health needs
  • access to multi-sectoral mentors and sponsors
  • participate in value-added professional development training, internship and lab exchange opportunities
  • network with a community of AgeTech researchers and professionals
  • receive support to identify and attain career goals

Eligibility

  • Domestic and international graduate students or postdoctoral fellows must participate full-time in their respective program at a Canadian post-secondary institution or research institute.
  • Early career researcher applicants must be within the first 5 years (60 months) of a full-time academic appointment at a Canadian post-secondary institution or research institute.
  • All applicants must be engaged in academic study/research aligned with the mission and vision of EPIC-AT and willing to participate fully in the training platform program.
  • Applicants may not hold an AGE-WELL Annual Graduate and Postdoctoral Award concurrently with an EPIC-AT Fellowship.

Program Requirements

Training

Fellowship holders will be automatically enrolled in the 1-year EPIC-AT training and mentorship program and are expected to participate actively in online courses, seminar series, professional development activities, a capstone project and annual meeting. The expected time commitment of the training and mentorship program is approximately 50-60 hours over the course of 1 year.

Reporting

Fellowship holders are required to complete Individual Development Plans and report on their publications, presentations, and progress made towards goals.

Fellow institutions will report on expenditures of EPIC-AT funds by submitting a Form 300 to training@agewell-nce.ca no later than April 30 of each year for the duration of the fellowship.

Acknowledging EPIC-AT

EPIC-AT fellows will acknowledge the fellowship program in their presentations, publications, and other knowledge translation activities related to research conducted during their fellowship period.

Adjudication Criteria

All applications will undergo an administrative round of review to confirm eligibility and relevance of the applicant’s research to stakeholders’ lived experiences.

Eligible applications will then be reviewed by a team of field experts using the following criteria:

Alignment with EPIC-AT Program Goals 25%
  • the applicant’s research is relevant to EPIC-AT values and mission
  • the applicant seeks to go beyond traditional disciplinary boundaries
  • the applicant is interested in creating real-world solutions
Personal Statement 25%
  • achievements of the applicant relative to other researchers at the same career stage
  • the applicant demonstrates a vested interest in their research and career development
  • the applicant has clearly identified the benefits of participating in EPIC-AT
Scholarly Merit 25%
  • the applicant’s research is original or novel
  • the appropriateness of the methods and theoretical approach
  • probability that the objectives will be met within the timeline proposed
  • involvement of partners or stakeholders in the design and conduct of proposed activities
  • the applicant has or will consider EDI in research
Potential Impact and Feasibility 25%
  • the applicant’s research has potential positive impact on the lives of older adults and caregivers
  • the associated benefits to older adults and caregivers feasibly described
  • the applicant’s letters of reference indicate that the applicant and their work have excellent potential positive impact

Required Documents Checklist

Award applicants must submit the following:

  • Online application form in Forum
  • Two confidential letters of support (one must be from your current or proposed supervisor; in the case of ECRs one letter must be from a department head or equivalent)
  • Trainee applicants must provide formal evidence of enrolment in a Master’s or Doctoral program or Post-Doctoral position
  • Curriculum Vitae (no specified format)

Important Dates

Forum Application Opens: 23 May, 2022
Completed Applications Due: 13 June, 2022
Results Available: August, 2022
Fellowship Term: 1 September 2022 - 31 August 2022
Funding Disbursement Schedule: 1 September 2022, 1 March 2022

3. ALIGNMENT WITH EPIC-AT PROGRAM

Statement of alignment with EPIC-AT Program Goals

EPIC-AT is inviting fellowship applications from those trainees and ECRs researching in AgeTech, specifically related to digital health solutions for older adults with complex health needs and their caregivers.

In this section, applicants should describe:
  1. How does your research connect to research foci of EPIC-AT? How does your work align with its mission?
  2. Why is this work important to you?
  3. How does your project transcend typical disciplinary boundaries?
  4. Will this work result in real-world solutions? Why or why not? If yes, how?
{$item}

4. PERSONAL STATEMENT

Biography

EPIC-AT Fellows will be the catalyst that drives forward the Canadian innovation landscape in AgeTech in the digital health solutions for older adults with complex health needs and their caregivers.

In this section, applicants should describe:
  1. What past experiences and achievements make you an ideal EPIC-AT Fellow?
{$item}

Career Path
In this section applicants should describe:
  1. What are your career goals?
  2. Where do you see yourself in 5-10 years?
  3. What skills gaps have you identified for yourself that you would like to fill over the next year?
  4. How do you see EPIC-AT helping you achieve your goals?
{$item}

5. SCHOLARLY MERIT AND QUALITY OF PROPOSED RESEARCH

Research focus and objectives

In this section describe the following aspects of your research:

  1. What is the overall aim of your research?
  2. What are your specific research questions (if appropriate)
  3. List your specific objectives - these should include both the research objectives AND the ”non-academic” objectives, such as knowledge transfer etc. (these objectives should be related to the specific project activities that will be mapped out in “tasks/activities” in the next section)
{$item}

How will you achieve your project goals?

In this section describe the following aspects of your research:

  1. Brief overview of the approach (design/methods) you will use to meet your project objectives
  2. Describe the type of research being undertaken e.g. technology development, review, feasibility study, pilot study, requirements analysis, prototype development, intervention study, evaluation study, etc.
  3. Describe the tasks and activities planned (provide detail on specific tasks to be carried out to meet the project objectives you identified above). “Activities” may include research activities, KT, innovation, commercialization, team-building and training, etc.
  4. Provide specific timing of the various tasks, activities and milestones, where milestones are critical points in the project (e.g., completion of a task)
{$item}

Stakeholder Engagement

Stakeholder engagement is a foundational aspect of EPIC-AT’s approach to research excellence. In this section, describe:

  1. How have, or how will, the principles of EDI be incorporated into your research plan?
  2. Are partners and/or stakeholders involved in the design and conduct of proposed activities? If yes, how? If no, why not?
{$item}

6. POTENTIAL IMPACT AND FEASIBILITY

Potential Impact

In this section, please provide a brief statement of the potential positive impact your work will have on the lives of older adults with complex health needs and their caregivers.

As applicable, address the following:

Social innovation
What are practical benefits of your research to the wider community?

Technological innovation
What are the novel aspects and contributions of your research from a technical point of view?

Policy and practice innovation
How might policies, services and care be transformed by your research?

Scientific innovation
What are the key scientific outputs from this research?

{$item}

Impact Plan

EPIC-AT seeks to equip trainees and ECRs with the skills to translate their work into real-world impact.

While the success ultimately depends on the rate of uptake and meaningful application of knowledge or products by end users, non-traditional academic knowledge mobilization, commercialization and effective implementation of solutions are a platform goal.

Not every Fellow is expected to be directly responsible for a commercial outcome or uptake of knowledge, but all projects should be actively contributing to these overall goals.

Please address your plan to ensure your work achieves the impact described in the previous section.

{$item}
